root.name: Yu-Gi-Oh! Ultimate Masters: World Championship Tournament 2006
root.description: OverviewYu-Gi-Oh! Ultimate Masters: World Championship Tournament 2006 is a card battling game developed and published by Konami for the Game Boy Advance platform.GameplayYu-Gi-Oh! Ultimate Masters: World Championship Tournament 2006 uses the same rules (as of the games release) as the physical Yu-Gi-Oh! card game.There is no story mode in Championship Tournament 2006, in its place is a free duel mode in which the player can choose the opponent to duel. The opponents can be dueled as many times as wanted.There is also a duel challenge mode in which the player can either try and solve a puzzle, try a theme duel, or try and survive in a survival duel.Duel PointsDuel points can be earned by defeating opponents in free duel mode or duel puzzle mode. These duel points can be used to "buy" in game packs of cards. Many of the packs in this game are digital counterparts to the real life packs.
